Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wayne T
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Rome staying at the Contilia. Friendly helpful staff with good level of English. Room fine although a little warm, even in April, the only issue being the inability to regulate the shower temperature. Food typically continental but always fresh and plenty of it. Great locality as next to termini so no taxi required. Also easy to access all the sights, 20 mins to Colesseo, Trevi Fountain etc. Would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “Not good and expensive”
Reviews.Author: MaluPena
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is 4 blocks away from Termini train station. That sounds good to avoid cab fare to the hotel, but the shady characters hanging around at every hour are not worth your worries. Furthermore, the subway station in Termini is practically 3 blocks below surface and through an underground path, so you end up walking a lot before you get there. On the other hand it is very close to a lot of buses, but you will have to buy a bus route map as no info or tourist boreau has one available. Location: 6 out of 10. The room was tiny as a matchbox. Our two lugages barely fitted in. I was on my honeymoon so I asked for a queen bed, but I was given one of the smallest rooms in the second floor with two single beds stuck together!!! the bathroom was about 2 sq. mts, and the shower "space" could barely fit a skinny person. Everytime I moved I touched the faucet, not nice! The TV, al 12¨ of it, was mounted 2 mts high, and it was one of those plasma that can only be seen standing right in front of it. So when you layed on the bed, you could only see a black screen. how stupid!! The TV was useless and you couldn´t see any of the 4 (yes, four) channels available.Room: 4 out of 10. Considering it was over 110 EUROS, look for another place!

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mateus_de_Castro
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome in our honeymoon. We went traveling around the country, and went back to Rome. Our previous hotel in Rome, the Fellini Inn, was full when we were to return. So, reading reviews, we booked on this hotel. What a mistake!!! The location is terrible. Dangerous and without a single typical restaurant or shop. It´s like you are in a flea market. The hotel itself is terrible. We were given a room with one small bad lamp. Impossible to read anything in it. We changed rooms, and were given one with the flush box opened. Smelled really bad. The towels seemed like cheap dish towels. And I could go on. We called the Fellini and were happy to discover that they had a cancellation and could take us in for our last couple of days. I truly can´t recommend this hotel. Avoid it!

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: IL-PINE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short trip to Rome and we are glad that we had only stayed for 3 nights. The photos on the website certainly did not match with the kind of room we were given. The room was extremely small, and there was no room to place the luggage on the floor – we had to place them on the wardrobe. I couldn’t even take a proper shower as it was really small. Both myself and my wife are slim! The temperatures of the shower knob where inverted so when I set the lever on the hot setting, cold water poured out and it took us some time to realise this – my wife was already worrying we did not have any hot water! The towels were really thin and got wet very quickly. Some sites say that the rooms of this hotel have a minibar ours did not have. The bed was not that comfortable and the pillows really thin. The bed headrest was covered with old upholstery rather than a wooden one as appears on the site’s photos. At least our room was quiet as it overlooked a yard. Another drawback of this hotel is that it has the key system instead of a card for accessing the room so if the receptionist is busy with other customers expect to wait for the key. Finally the breakfast was very poor....!! The breakfast area is quite welcoming and even the main entrance however the room and the service was certainly not as expected. If you are staying in Rome for long periods go for better reviewed hotels as it could make a great deal of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Termini hotel with class.”
Reviews.Author: POLLYANNA57
Reviews.Content: Chose the Contilia for a one night stay, only because it was close to Rome Termini where we arrived early evening and departed from early next morning. And yes it was perfect for that. The Contilia was a very stylish, impressive hotel and gave us the impression of being a very new fitout to hotel of an older apartment building. The hotel is only 2 streets down on the left from the Termini front entrance. Look at McDonalds and take the Via to the left of that. Easy to find and pull luggage to even at night. Lots of hotels in the area and the street so safe too. Reception staff were extremely pleasant, helpful and spoke English. There is a modern elevator servicing floors to the 5th. The mechanics of the elevator take up the cavity of the cage to the 6th floor space, unavoidable. Great care and respect of the original building has been taken in the conversion to an hotel, which we appreciated. We had Room 602 so took the elevator to the 5th floor and carried our suitcases up the stairs to our room. No problem. It was worth the effort. Room 602 accesses the terrazza running the width of the hotel frontage. I had requested a room with a balcony or Terrazza if possible, and was delighted with 602. We later enjoyed the pleasant Rome evening and rooftop views outside very happily by ourselves. Bliss. The bedroom was large with an attractive modern fitout as was the tiled bathroom, which had a jet bath and wall hairdryer. We had air conditioning, a mini frig, free Wifi and the bed was large and extremely comfortable. Cleanliness of our room and whole hotel impeccable. Everything looked brand new. The breakfast room was very large, beautifully decorated, again sparkling and the layout and food available was excellent. Staff were very efficient. We had Dinner in a restaurant one street up parallel to hotel, and full of locals which made my husband think he had found heaven when they had his favourite pasta Tortellini Alla Crema on menu. Serving was vat sized (a giveaway as Italian servings small) and the tortellini pasta had not been cooked long enough, it tasted raw. Cheap anyway but this area is full of eating places so suggest ask hotel staff for recommendations. From many visits to Rome we hadn't considered that area, Termini, as a salubrious place for a longer visit for tourism purposes. The Contilia has changed our minds. It will become very popular I suspect. The Contilia was a wonderful hotel, in a great spot and excellent value for money. It would be possible to use The Contilia as a hub if planning to travel by train to locations close to but outside Rome and the Metro at the Termini is advantageous for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: Sallie F
Reviews.Content: Our first night was in a quaint room. Didn't expect American standards to be met, but it was clean. Second nite was in the "apartment" as they had no hotel room for us. (Our reservation got cancelled without our knowledge.) Only thing apartment has going for it is size. It was horrible-exposed wires seemed hazardous if children were present, tub was old, chipped and stained (maybe dirty?), kitchen was not fully equipped, couldn't find the refrigerator. And the kicker was we had to pay more for the apartment dump. Beds in hotel and apartment felt like we were sleeping on the floor. On the plus side - the food at breakfast was very good and the location is fantastic being close to the termini.

Reviews.Title: “Fast WiFi and close to metro and grocery store (SMA). This is on Via Amadeo and very close to Termini and is the best hotel I ha”
Reviews.Author: Kristjan84
Reviews.Content: As per the title, I highly recommend this hotel as your first choice. Very easy to get to from Termink and close to the metro. Great food choices nearby whether you like true Italian cuisine or cheaper food (kabab) this is the spot. This area is safe, from my many experiences in this area of Rome. Enjoy your travels in this city!

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: GRcitizen
Reviews.Content: Here's my 100% honest and unbiased opinion: Rome hotels are all expensive to begin with so we knew we weren't getting the Ritz right from the start. I've read some negative reviews about the service but ours was ok. The room however was something different. The WiFi was completely ineffective, the bed was very uncomfortable, the AC stopped working randomly, area was VERY noisy, warm water ceases after 8am, internet costs 2 euro per device, rates were raised on us upon checkout by 20 euro without warning, clerk told us 60 euro for cab to the airport but when we hailed one they said 40 was fine, and breakfast requires a drill bit to open the rolls. The good parts include location which was close to Termini, commercial businesses close by, decent service, and security by keycard access. This hotel would be fine for the boys out on the town but not so much for couples and the more seasoned citizens. The Termini area is a little shady but nothing to get paranoid about. Women may get some verbal jabs but nothing physical. In my opinion, Rome is such a great and exciting city that it's one place you should allow yourself to spend a few more dollars and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value place in the Station Area”
Reviews.Author: tungstenthedog
Reviews.Content: We turned up late in the evening and this place was easy to find. Rooms are very suitable with A/C - very important in Rome in the summer. Close to Termini station, but about 20 mins walk from the main sights in town. But if you want yuou can take the metro from Termini.... Breakfast was good - plenty of spread, but have had better in Italy really. Staff were always very friendly - especially the man who says he was from Manchester who had a very dry wit I think... The one negative I can say is that the cleaning staff start with their rounds at circa 7am. They have walkie talkies, and throw clean linen at the bedroom doors very early. We were there 5 nights, and all except the public holiday in Italy, were we woken by flying laundry and loud conversation in the corridor outside our room!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to an apartment”
Reviews.Author: Caroline201107
Reviews.Content: After spending 7 days of a Med cruise, we came to the Hotel Contilia very tired. We were early arriving and were informed our room we had booked was not available but if we wanted to stay in an apartment they could do that for us at same cost. My husband and I took a look, the elavator was very old and could only hold 3 people. It was a two bedroom apartment, with a living and kitchen! In one room there was a double bed and a single and the other room was a beautiful qeen bed. It was a little hard, but we were so tired it did not matter. There was a balcony looking out into the courtyard so we did not hear any noise from the street. There was a breakfast the next morning but we got up late a had to catch our cab back to the airport. The hotel was close to the Termini station. Would stay again. Hope to go back to Rome sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: simonmajor7
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical after reading some of the reviews about the hotel before we left. However we felt the hotel was great value (let's face it, it's not the most expensive hotel and it is in Rome, so why are people expecting five star luxury!) We were greeted with very helpful reception staff, who were happy to help throughout our stay. I think the hotel may have been refurbished since some of the reviews, so don't base your decision from a bad review over a year ago. It is well decorated, very clean and had everything we needed for a four night stay. The breakfasts were a typical European breakfast, nothing spectacular but good coffee and some nice pastries. The room was a reasonable size, but was clean and comfortable and the bathroom seemed brand new, again being above my expectations. In particular the air conditioning in the room was very good (and quiet!) which was essential as it was a very hot week! I would completely disagree with some of the reviews who say the location is not great. You are a very short walk away from Termini to get buses or the metro. We also walked down to the Colosseum on the evenings which took us 20 minutes and around the same to the Trevi area (baring in mind we are in our twenties and quick walkers!) The road itself is not the most attractive but at no stage did we feel unsafe. I would recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to explore the city and does not want to splash out on a more expensive hotel. If you go with an open mind on the amount you have spent, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “All the Reviews are True!”
Reviews.Author: Visby08
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all the reviews on tripadvisor.com (thank you all very much) and all the reviews are true including the "grumpy" older man at reception. I smiled to myself when I saw him and had a pleasant experience with him because of you all warning me ahead of time. I think it is because the other men and women working reception are so friendly that Mr. Grumpy stands out. He really isn't grumpy, just busy. I love this hotel and am going back soon! It is so close to the Termini and everything else! The rooms are cozy and small just like they are going to be everywhere in Europe. You have to go outside the bathroom to change your mind, as my Mother would say, because the bathrooms are small, but that is to be expected! Embrace it and you'll love it! The free morning breakfast had cappacino and americano coffee, juice, bread rolls which I am now craving, turkey meat, cheese and cereals. We took the train from the airport to the Termini and it was very easy. The street outside the hotel is very busy during the day and it was safe. There is a little shopping center to buy water, food or incidentals by the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore (you must visit this Basiclica to see where Bernini is buried). Day trip tours leave from this Basiclica's square and it is an easy walk to and from the hotel. We went to Napoli and Pompeii on a day trip and it was absolutely amazing! It was kind of creepy at 6:45 am walking to the meeting place for the day trip because the streets literally close up and nothing is open and there is no place to get coffee that early, unless you go to the Termini. The internet was free and worked well in our second floor room. They also had a DVD player on the television in the room, a safe and a small refrigerator! The room looked out into a courtyard and it was very quiet. This is a little gem of a hotel and I can hardly wait to return next February. I hope they still have those rolls!

Reviews.Title: “Contilia, Contilia”
Reviews.Author: yoyocu
Reviews.Content: we stayed there from the 18th to the 20th. The hotel was better than what all the reports we had read, pictures we had seen, etc. A beautiful property with gorgeous polished marble floors. When you are outside you can not imagine what the hotel looks like in the inside. So clean, so bright, the rooms very elegant, the bathrooms modern and elegant. Everything in the hotel was in great shape. The breakfast, excellent, a great continental breakfast in an big and elegant dining room. The best thing the hotel has is the great staff its personalized treatment and that thing that makes you feel at home. If I go to Rome again I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel can ruin your trip to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda_and_Tyler
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. You might be tempted because of the great price.... BUT : 1)the bed was so hard i woke up in pain every morning, and that's if i even could fall asleep at night 2)it is dirty. The sheets were gross, the bathroom so tiny and gross. ew. 3)If you pick it for the 'included breakfast' you are wasting your money. The breakfast was disgusting. hard rolls, cheese, meat and stale croissants. 4)It is too far from everything.... we walked miles everyday. The area is also very sketchy. .... Bottom line. if you come to rome on vacation and are looking for a holiday - don't stay here. And this is coming from someone who is used to hostels and has no problem with them. If you are in transit, and need somewhere close to the train station to crash then you could maybe consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kiwisteveandali
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location as only a couple of minutes walk from Termini station. The staff were very helpful, the breakfast was plentiful but basic, the price was excellent for central Rome. Negatives was the room was very small and the shower smaller.

Reviews.Title: “not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: sp27toronto
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from expedia.ca and it was advertised as a 3star for $220 night. When we arrived we were told we were staying in the apartment down the street!! We were escorted three doors down to seedy apartment that also housed a pensione and a 1star hotel. We went back to the concierge at the hotel and insisted we be moved to the main hotel but were told no rooms available. Try again in the morning. Before turning in we asked again, and again no other rooms. I called American Express and placed a dispute on the transation based on misrepresentation, and we decided to checkout in the morning since we didn't have a choice. The walls were paper thin, we heard a guy throwing up all night, a baby crying, a couple making out, and above us was a kitchen and when the chairs were dragged across the floor, they may as well been in bed with us. The next morning we were given a room in the hotel, thank God!! All I can say is the other reviews on Tripadvisor are bang on. The room was clean, that's it. The washroom is substandard for a 3star and the stairways and hallways dingy. Breakfast is buns, ham, cheese, jam and powdered juice and coffee. We ate out. We have stayed in Rome 5 times in the last 4 years and this is not up to 3star status. By the way none of our former hotels had availability. Other than the cleanliness the only other good thing were the front desk staff. Very concerned and attentive. Thank you. But our focus was the downtown core and it was a hike and overpriced for what we got. By the way, we were never offered a discount for staying in the apartment we paid the hotel rate. Very sneaky.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: AventuraBird
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Termin Station, that was excellent. Good and not expensive restaurants nearby. But our agent sold us the hotel as a four stars. Never!!! Old hotel, bad breakfast, old beds with very old and some disgusting mattresses!!! Next time, I will search a 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: medlhuber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The biggest benefit in my opinion would be the fact it is only 2-3 blocks from Termini Station. We arrived via train and left via train to FCO airport. We also used the Metro to get around Rome the whole time we were there. If you're not familiar with the subway in Rome there are 2 major lines and they cross at Termini, so if you want go anywhere you can do it with ease from this location. Now the neighborhood itself isn't the greatest but its not the worst either. There are some good places to eat nearby and the hotel staff which all spoke good English were able to point us to those establishments. Free Breakfast included with our room. Also free wifi in the lobby. The room was not huge but not as tiny as our hotel in Paris. It had nice decor and we enjoyed it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok for 1 night...”
Reviews.Author: trinity1981
Reviews.Content: As we didn't book a room in Rome in advance, we were quite happy to find one during the weekend. Well.. wasn't great, very hot, no air-con and the HK made us wake up early. Obviously they wanted to clean the room but we still have had like 2 hours till check out time. During the breakfast felt really embarrassed, same problem... probably we were too late for them. But people are on holiday, don't wanna be in rush. After checking out there were no space to store our luggage, so we were told to leave them on the floor in front of the reception! Not a safe solution...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Rana2008
Reviews.Content: Just returned from rome me and my husband were celebrating our anniversary, we booked in a guest house but when we arrived there it was too small and not comfortable at all so we took a walk beside it and found contilia hotel which was very good hotel in a great location, when I saw the pics here I was shocked, the room 108 was very nice and recently renovated, the bathroom was so clean, the staff was so helpful and despite all this the cost was less than the guest house's.beside this they were having free Wifi . I really recommend contilia for everyone going Rome.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't wait to go home!!”
Reviews.Author: leighc19
Reviews.Content: the rooms are kept clean every day... thats the best thing i can say! very small rooms, no books or information in the rooms about the mini bar (cans of coke costing 3 euro) or anything about times breakfast starts. breakfast is bread and jam thats pretty much it!!... if your the unlucky one who gets a room facing the back of the hotel then be prepaired for 4 cats living below who scream unnaturally 24/7. location wasnt that great it felt like the poorest part of rome but the metro is a 2 min walk to escape. it took us 2 days but we eventually found pubs near by which were great at night. staff were completly unhelpful, if you ask them for some information they will make it as breif as possible as if they want you to leave them alone. the showers are so small when you are in them that you will actually laugh. i am well aware that this hotel is cheap and i know i shouldnt have expected much but in my opinion just pay a little extra and stay somewhere else... i wish i did!!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: irek1977
Reviews.Content: As title, Location great - 5min tube, train, etc. The hote avarage. Basic breakfast, no wifi internet in our room which was last from the reception (other building). Recomended for weekend/city brakeup to 3 night stay and no more. As the location is good this hotel received Avarage note, otherwise will be poor.

Reviews.Title: “Modest, but very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shes0so0free
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived in the area around the Termini Station, just two blocks from the Contilia, it was almost midnight. The neighborhood seemed a little scary and dirty. We were shocked when we woke up in the late morning and found ourselves in a cute little area with shops and small restaurants. Apparently we'd been there late enough that everything was closed, but the street sweepers, who are incredibly diligent in Rome, hadn't been through yet. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel had air conditioning, which was amazing as we were there in the middle of a heat wave. The staff was friendly and the free breakfast was satisfying. I'd stay here again, the location is brilliant, only four blocks from the Coloseum!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTeacherUSA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Contilia is a great value. Our room was a triple with a small balcony opening onto the central courtyard. The room was large by European standards with a large bathroom that looked as if it had been recently updated. The desk staff is friendly and speaks English. We especially enjoyed the free wifi. The air conditioning worked well and our room was very quiet. The continental breakfast consisted of rolls, pastry, ham and cheese, cereals, yogurt, juice and coffee. The hotel is located within 5 minutes walking distance to the train station and a metro stop, as well as many major sites of Rome. The neighborhood looks a little run down, but I was never afraid of walking around even at night. There is a market nearby and many cafes and shops in the area. I will stay here again next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Run down small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ida32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing for me. Stuff was nice and helpful but rooms were small and bathroom was ridiculous. AC was too loud. It seemed clean to me though. Location is ok, you can walk to all main attraction sites. Anyway i wouldn't come back, and if i wanted to stay longer i would change the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, this was excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: foxon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on line from UK via the UniTravel website. We thought that we had booked a bed and breakfast called Budget B & B with a little kitchen that we could use but when we arrived the staff told us that the B&B was now part of the Hotel Contilia. I have to admit I was a little disappointed not to have the kitchen facility as I hadn't even taken a travel kettle, plus it meant we had no fridge. Having said that, the Hotel Contilia was very nice. The staff were very friendly and pleasant, the hotel was what I would describe as typical old italian - ie marble floors, tired worn looking curtains and fabrics, but all in keeping with the property. Small rooms with high ceilings, reasonable bathroom although no shelf to stand shampoo etc and our air conditioning worked fine. My son and I were travelling with his friend and his mum (long weekend break for their 16th birthdays and to celebrate end of GCSE exams), and it would have been nice if we could have been on the same floor instead of us in 402 and them in 115 - having to text to meet for breakfast etc instead of a short trip down the hall. The location was fine so long as you stayed on this side of Termini railway station - the other side was as you'd expect near a station! There were plenty of restaurants, bars, cafes etc nearby, plus a small supermarket between the hotel and the station and a larger one up near Maggiore which was very well stocked. Having said that the continental style breakfast was actually quite nice. Tea, coffee, juice (packet flavour), cereals, fruit, yoghurt, bread, cheese, meats and lovely pastries. We mostly used the open top bus to get around (a couple of minutes walk to Maggiore stop), excellent value as we got a family ticket (2 adults plus our 2 15 year olds) which gave us 2 days unlimited travel for 45 Euros total. The two routes covered the whole of the area we wanted to visit so saved a lot of achy feet and calves. Most major sights were reduced rate or even free for the boys (under 18). Only downside was that the buses stopped around 7 or 8pm depending on the route you were on so we did use the metro at night to go and see Colosseum, St Peter's, and Trevi Fountain lit up. The metro was ok, wouldn't want to be traveling alone down there but I would say that about metro anywhere in the world. All in all a good hotel, in a good location. Not luxury but then we only paid 480 Euros for 3 nights (total for 4 people) so 40 Euros each per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, helpful staff, clean room, close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: annkr
Reviews.Content: Arriving by bus from Ciampino, we just needed one night before our regular hotel reservation started. On Priceline we had tried for another hotel, and received Hotel Contilia instead. ($113) A pleasant surprise, it was a quick walk from Termini to the hotel, and the little elevator made the 5th floor room quite nice, as we had a view of the courtyard across the street. Although Termini was a traffic nightmare, the hotel's street was quiet with little traffic. Bathroom was small, but air conditioning was fine, and all looked clean. Not stylish decor, a little dark with the shutters closed, but the marble floored lobby felt quite Italian. They also have free wifi, which worked fine. Breakfast was also a pleasant surprise, with a buffet of great bakery goodies, butter, nutella, jams, cheese and salami, juice, yogurt, cereals, and coffees & teas. Piazza Maggiore was just a block away, and we walked to dinner at Restaurant Target, a Rick Steves recommendation, about 6 blocks away. If we were arriving at Termini again, it would be a great overnight stay. We liked the location of our other hotel better, but for the price this was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value of money...”
Reviews.Author: zoiGreece
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the internet and got it for 90 euros per night per triple room. We were nine people and that means three triples. Our room was great, with a view on the central road, really clean and spacious.The bathroom was very clean too. The second room was just as ours, but the third one had a view on a backyeard and the bathroom smelled bad, although it was clean. I later realised that I found that kind of smell in many places in Rome, even in luxurious shops. However it was very clean, just ask for a room with a view on the central road. The staff was really kind and helped us. They booked a minivan to take us to the airport at a great price so we didn't have to walk at all (really helpful as we had a lot of baggage). The breakfast was good too, but I didn't like the coffee (you get it out of a machine and I prefer the classic cappuccino).It's within a walking dinstance from the train station and the tube. So if you don't want to walk to the great monuments of Rome (about 30 minutes walking, but great tour), you can take the tube and you will be there in 3 minutes (Fontana di Trevi, Vatican, Colosseum, Pantheon and many others).The hotel offers free internet access as well. I intend to go back to Rome in June, because I stayed there only for one night and it's not enough. I will certainly book at the same hotel, as the price is really good comparing to what the hotel offers. BEAR IN MIND: Don't eat at any reastaurant near the Vatican! They offer full meals with only 10 euros but you end up hungry, as they are just awful! There are many restaurants near the train station and the hotel, where you pay about 15 euros per person and you eat local Italian dishes! You can take pizza from any shop that smells pizza and it will be delicious (and really cheap). Just don't eat near the monuments or where they have fixed prices. You will just lose 10 euros and you will get angry!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but ok”
Reviews.Author: waterangel21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not my favorite of the trip, but wasn't the worst. The room was ok, the smallest we had. It was near the train station, which was convenient to travel, but not great when wandering around looking for dinner after dark. There was also a funny smell in the hallways and bathrooms. Something in the water? Breakfast every morning was fine, but sometimes was very busy and the tables couldn't be cleaned off quick enough.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: arianneleigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Contilia for five days. The air conditioning was non existent. The hotel was definitely not modernized or updated. It was by far the smallest bathroom I had on my entire trip. The place was clean and my room was cleaned every day of my stay there. The area of the hotel feels worse when walking from the train station than when coming back from the main sights of Rome. The breakfast was terrible. Honestly, all I need is some juice, pastry, and fresh fruit like an apple and I'm happy. The only thing they served was stale buns, cheese and cold meat. I stayed there because it was cheap and easy to explore Rome from. Keep your expectations low and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Read this before you think about Contilia”
Reviews.Author: t-dev-7
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife are very surprised to see all the positive reviews on Contilia. We had the worst possible experience here. We booked two days from an online website in the US. We arrived at the hotel and soon after, my wife didn't feel safe in the neighborhood. That termini area is somewhat shady. The room was in a pretty run down condition. Shower door was broken, there were stains all over the comforter (white ones, use your imagination), AC didn't work properly, ornaments, towels, furniture all in very bad shape. This is the good part so far. We wanted to check out from this hotel after our first day. The manager didn't let us, said we had to pay for the entire duration of the reservation. We kindly said we don't feel safe here and the rooms are in a pretty bad condition, the manager and the staff argued very aggressively saying it is impossible for us to check out early, kept saying they have a 48 hour cancellation policy. They did not understand the difference between cancelling a reservation and checking out early due to customer dissatisfaction. I insisted on not paying for the second day as I had no intention of staying here and the manager called the police. Then he started yelling at us and told us to evacuate our room in 10 minutes or he will throw away our stuff on the street. At this point, he is calling the police to make us pay for the second day AND he is throwing our stuff on the street, notice this guy's logic. He even showed us the finger (with his arm, Italian way). It was so ridicilous that the term unprofessional does not even begin to describe the staff at this hotel. We waited for the police for a while, they didn't show up. In the meantime, the manager was making calls to the station from his cell phone. Most probably the police could not have done anything anyway since they had no check out policy stated anywhere - but we offered half price for the second day so that we can go on our way and not waste the entire day waiting for the police. They took the offer with much animation and showmanship. Stay at this ridicilous establishment at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room.. helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lauraSeattle
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel only a couple of short blocks from Termini. I stayed 2 nights and my room was spotless. The front desk people were wonderful and offered nice restaurant suggestions nearby. The breakfast selection was above average with good food. All was wonderful here and I would return again. Although this was close to the station my room was very quiet and the walking back to the hotel after dinner was fine. This was an excellent choice for me and a very good value!

Reviews.Title: “M.D room 209”
Reviews.Author: CreativeSwedish
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel, don´t know if I just had luck to get that nice room I got. But is hard to understand that this nice hotel only have 3 stars. If you look at it overall-then yes I can see why the hotel only has 3 stars. They don´t have laundry services (but there is several around the hotel), or room services-which is some of the needs to be ranked at a 4 stars hotel. But the rooms (or my singel room) are really nice and beatiful. (the standars are high at this hotel!!) And clean too! The bathroom with marmor floor felt new and fresh, well in fact the whole hotels marmor floor felt new. They sure know how to clean there. Many hotels have nice decorations, beutiful designs and so on...but unfortely not all hotels seams to prioritate cleaning. The staff are even they really nice. Many people in Italy (or rome any way)are bad at english, and sometimes it can be hard to try to communicate with them. But this staff are good at english, and they are very helpful. I tried to find any mailbox to post my postcards, and asked several people near the termini station where I could post my postcards. But know one could tell me (not even the policemen I asked) - because no one I asked knew a single word on english. So I went back to the hotel, and they told me how the postboxes looked like, and where I could find them. (hehe, yeah I know-stupid of me not to find the red mailboxes that was all around the station termini- but my point is-the people in rome are terrible at english, so it´s a good idea to stay at a hotel there they know english) And no - people working at hotels in rome don´t necessarily speak english. I believe I tryed to book rooms in 4 other hotels, but not one of the staff at these hotels could english. They tried to mix some english words with italian - which is nice, I mean they really tried. But in a city that I had never been before, It felt important to have someone that knew the area that I could talk to. of course - you could always talk to the turist information...if you have time and don´t bother to have to stand in line for a while... This is a nice hotel - definitely worth the money! I don´t believe any one that is looking for a 3 stars hotel are going to be disappointed at this hotel and its staff. When I get back to rome (and I will beacuse I throw a coint fontana di trevi...) I will definitely come back to this nice hotel... // M.D at room 209

Reviews.Title: “Elegant good priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandes
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Contilia has an excellant location 2 blocks from the Rome Termini train station. The room was wallpapered in damask. The room was spotlessly clean, large and comfortable. Continenal breakfast was good with croissants, juice, cereal, coffee and more. I felt safe in the area which has greatly improved in the last several years. Being two blocks from the metro made getting around Rome very easy. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorge27
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and reasonably priced. it is a good location, walkable to sights and the train station. The rooms are newly renovated and quite spacious for the area. Ask for room 301, it's a suite, with a jacuzzi and double sinks. The front staff is kind, courteous, helpful. Breakfast is quite good, cereals, pastries, meats, cheese, coffee, tea, etc. There are many quaint bars, cafes, in the locale, and 2 grocery stores within a block for stocking up on snacks, wine etc. Do be aware of pick pockets in the area of the train station. You can take the train from the airport, walk a block and you're at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, big room compared to others”
Reviews.Author: Kev1351
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline and was given this hotel . Prepaid in USD which helped quite a bit since the dollar is so low to the Euro. We paid $102 usd per night for a 3 night stay( including tax and fees). What a bargain compared to what others were charging. We were surprised how much we liked this place. Given a quiet room on the 5th floor. Two twin beds in a nice size room,very high ceiling, big bathrom with a step in shower. Small tv with Cnn and Bbc and various italian channels, mini fridge. The room was stuffy and the ac wasn't working so we just opened the window which overlooked a courtyard with other apartments overlooking it. What wonderful smells of pasta sauces cooking. Gets nosiy after 9am. Breakfast was included in the price and was good. Coffee, tea, pastries, rolls with cold cuts and cheese, juice. This hotel is on the "good" side of the train station. Would stay here again, even if we had to pay the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you see”
Reviews.Author: vvmitchell
Reviews.Content: Pro: very convenient to the train station for a early departure. Con: Room #514 was NOT as pictured on the web page. I booked 2 other rooms for accompaning travelers that were as pictured, #602 &301. However one was a suite and one other was a room as pictured. We ALL paid the same amount for 3 totally different rooms. Our room was sparcely decorated, old furniture, no decorator touches like wall paper, crown moulding or a remodeled bath. We spoke to the reception desk and he said the other rooms were a suite and a superior room. If this IS the case, Contilia should not supply photos without explaining these are NOT what you get for 155 euros! All 3 rooms cost 155 euros. They made no compensation and was not able to contact the manager before we left for the train at 5:45am. I WOULD NOT stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good digs in downtown”
Reviews.Author: MikemckIndiana_USA
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. We paid a little extra for a "superior" room and, considering that this is a downtown hotel, we felt that it was a good value. Our accomodations were clean and very satisfactory. Thankfully, it has an elevator. Location was convenient to the rail station, good restaurants, shops and all the sights. The staff was freindly and helpful. We would definitely stay here if ever in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: Artkeb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has several things going for it: it is very conveniently located in terms of getting to both the central airport and the Campiani Airport, the room we stayed in was nicely decorated, it was clean, it had a fridge, and a new TV with several cable channels. However, the hotel suffered somewhat in comparison to others we stayed in during our visits to both Florence and Paris, despite the fact that it was considerably more expensive. We were not entirely sure where the extra money was spent: certainly not on lightbulbs, as our room was badly lit for much of our three nights there due to one that had not been replaced; and definitely not the all inclusive breakfast, which was stocked with supercheap food (e.g. fake orange juice, stale bread rolls, nutella-filled croissants). However, this is perhaps what 150 Euros a night gets you in Rome - something okay but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Italian service....”
Reviews.Author: alikus
Reviews.Content: The room was very good: clean, big for European hotels with nice bathroom and modern air-conditioning system. Though no iron/ironing board, no tea/coffee maker. The hotel is very centrally located. The big disappointment is stupid front desk service. Half of the staff didn't speak a decent English and were not very helpful if you paid not in cash but with credit card. They were reluctant to help with calling places where only Italian-speaker could call to...This totally spoilt our stay...So, go there if you are good at Italian ;)

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: GI47
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome more than 15 times. Admittedly, accommodations are not quite up to US standards. However, the hotel Contilia was an absolute disgrace. We had made reservations for a double room four months prior to our arrival. When we checked in, we were given the smallest room we have ever seen. A jail cell would have been larger! When we complained to the front desk we were told that all rooms were the same and there were none larger. This must have been a lie based upon other reviews of this hotel. We were given a single room and charged as a double. As soon as you got out of bed you had a step up to the bathroom. The bathroom door was unable to open all the way due to a shabby desk next to it. The door even had a big gash in it from others trying to open it. The breakfast was minimal at best. One guest had the chair he was sitting on crack. Luckily, he didn't get hurt! One additional insult: When we checked out , using our credit card, the rate was immediately converted from euros to US dollars. By doing this, we were actually charged $10 more per night than if the conversion would have been done by the credit card company. There are many three star hotels in this area. Be wise! Avoid the Hotel Contillia.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Contilia”
Reviews.Author: Liz789
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location- literally 3 blocks from the train station, and easy to find. The area is a little seedy, especially at night, but there are always so many people around that I never felt unsafe. We stayed in a quad room, which was very big with a very nice bathroom. The hotel was clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Debs50
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel at reasonable price. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Staff are friendly and very helpful...they made us feel welcome and that nothing was too much trouble! Opposite hotel is FAB trattoria `CECIO`... excellent food and service. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bebe12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Contilia during our 3 night stay in Rome last week. We got a special winter package for a reasonable price but I must say the room was disappointing. It was small, basic but nonetheless clean. The bathroom was extremely tiny which would have been alright with me except for the bad shower - a tiny area with a curtain and an old, horrid shower head. The water would go everywhere, wetting the whole bathroom if one was not really careful. The hotel doesn't give real towels and we had to contend with 'towels' that look like giant dish cloths. With 10EUR more, we could get a much better room down the road, which we did for our last night in Rome. Despite the disappointing room, I must say the hotel is only 2 blocks or 2 minutes from Termini main train station, which makes getting around Rome a real breeze. The fronk desk personnel was also friendly, especially Eva who was the only female fronk desk manager during my stay there. Overall, Hotel Contilia is only passable but I would spend a little more and get a better room elsewhere around that area.

Reviews.Title: “Vanessa from Cheshire. Lovely hotel very clean”
Reviews.Author: gherthy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, rooms where very clean and spacious. Staff where very nice nothing was too much trouble for them. Hotel is near Termini station so you can get to all the sights by Metro or by Bus. You even have the Tram 100 yards away. If you go to see the Trevi fountain you must call in to L'ANTICA BIRRERIA PERONI restaurant/bar its on Via di S. Marcello its a fantastic place good beer, good food and staff are brilliant. Three times we went its that good. Overall Rome was great, sights, hotel and the people but you must be carefull of pickpockets and you will see lots of beggars on the streets. A place you must go and see. I would recommend the Hotel Contilia too.

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: vanessa_Rio
Reviews.Content: This is a really good place to stay in Rome. Very close to the Termini Station. Breakfast included and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After pricing numerous hotels in Rome, we booked this hotel with some skepticism because of the negative reviews, and we were pleasantly surprised. Granted, this is not a first class luxury hotel, but it doesn't have first class luxury prices either. Overall, the hotel was clean and quiet. The breakfast was adequate, and the staff were helpful and friendly. The neighborhood isn't the greatest, but it's not scary. Being from New York City, we are used to walking, and we were able to walk to almost everything we wanted to see except the Vatican (which was an easy subway ride away). Yes, the towels are thin, and the temperature of the hot water kept changing in the shower requiring constant adjustments. However, these were minor issues for us. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for clean, reasonably priced, basic accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelsoften
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not great but not bad. Traveled together with another couple and had reserved 2 superior rooms. Upon check in we were given two rooms next to each other. The rooms were clean, hard beds, small shower stalls. They advertise jaccuzi showers in some of the suprior rooms which ours had. I am not a large person but I had problems maneuvering around in this shower Our friends' superior room was considerably larger than our superior room. After a discussion with Michael at the front desk they were able to move us the next day. The result was a much larger room with full bath. In short, all suprior rooms are not created equal. And thank you Micheal for your understanding and help. Breakfast was OK with a fair selection of items. Avoid the 9-9:30 rush. The neighborhood is a little iffy but generally not a big concern. If this is your first time in Rome then this neighborhood is ideal because it is only a few blocks from the Termini Station. Rome only has 2 metro lines and they intersect at Termini so you can head off in 4 directions from this point. Termini is also the main hub for the bus routes with a large interchange lot in front of the station. Once you learn the buses you will use them as much as the metro. Beware of pickpockets especially on Bus 64. I must plug a restuarant. If you have a sense of adventure hop on the #170 Bus and take it almost to the end of the line. You will be going to the far side of the Testaccio neighborhood and almost to the river.The restuarant is Il Pizzettiere 2 @Via Rubattion, 22 (06.57289587). They only have pizza and pasta dishes - no secondi. A family run place, great food and cheap prices. A great and rare combo in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK - Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Couple in their 40's. Came back from a med cruise. We were there May 22 to 26. We were anxious to see the location and the crowd around: better than expected but still, be carefull at night. We enjoyed it because it was near everything (restaurants, internet cafe) and almost all buses get to Termini (subway, train) which is a 5 minute walk to the hotel. There is a grocery store on the corner. Breakfeast was good and plentyfull except the oj. Overall was quiet with a/c and safe. We had a "courtyard" room (few dogs and cats at night) but with the window closed, very quiet. We payed 120 euros/night. Downsides: 1) the odor of humidity in the room was horrible... It's caused by the drapes on the walls; 2) the size of the shower (2 feet x 2 feet).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than reviewed!!”
Reviews.Author: sierram
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with much trepidation due to some of the reviews we'd read,but were pleasantly surprised by what we found. The rooms were lovely and spotlessly clean,nicely furnished and a great value for the money. The street where it's located is quite noisey (but who has control over that anyway?),but we found ALL of Rome to be extremely busy and quite crowded. What happened this past week anyway??? We spent 3 nights (5/11-5/13 and again 5/19-5/20) and never felt unsafe or frightened by anyone or anything we encountered. We had streetside rooms and found it quite interesting to have a view of 'real life' in Rome. The staff was quite nice and always helpful,which is always a plus in any hotel. A convenient walk to the Termini was an added bonus for us as we needed to take the train to Sorrento (take the new high speed...wonderful!) This was our second trip to Rome and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: maineiac
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here as part of a package. The front desk person who checked us in was extremely friendly and pleasant, and he speaks excellent English. The room was clean and extremely small - just big enough for the bed (2 twin beds pushed together, but my husband's feet hung over the edge and he's about 5'10".) There's also a closet and desk/desk chair. A small TV gets a few channels, including CNN. There was a mini-fridge in a compartment of the desk. The bathroom was also small, and very clean. The shower stall was tiny. The window looked down into a very grim courtyard. Very firm bed, flat pillows, thin linen towels. The biggest negative was the overwhelming sewer gas smell coming from the bathroom. We had to keep the bathroom door closed and the room window open. Breakfast was decent - ham and cheese, rolls and various croissants, cereals, coffee, and some sort of odd juice-like drinks. The neighborhood is a pretty dingy, but there are a lot of tourists around since there are many hotels in the area. It is a bit of a hike to most sights. It's easy to get here from the airport using the express train. I don't think I'd stay here again - I'd opt for a more convenient and pleasant neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Maryalamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Feb 2006. Close and convenient to the train station. We reserved two rooms, one being average size, the other tiny. (side by side rooms). One room did not have working heat and the front desk kept trying to ignore us, we eventually got a space heater and they were able to fix the heat for one day. Disappointed with their attitude towards the situation. Room felt clean and bed was fairly comfortable. Breakfast buffet with cereals and breads. Front desk helpful with directions and tours. Some expensive makeup mysteriously missing the last day as I was packing to leave. Unsure if somebody took it or I just left it there. Paid 65 Euro for a double bed for a single person. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being from Manhattan, New York, my family and I have high standards of quality...Hotel Contilia exceeded our expectations. My family (2 parents, my sister and I... both in early 20s and young professionals) went on our first family trip in years over Thanksgiving 2005 and decided to book online at Hotel Contilia. At first I was very skeptical because of some of the reviews written on this site about the surrounding areas (proximity to Termini) and also the size of the rooms. Upon arrival at the airport, we were told to take a train to the Termini and it worked out very well because of the proximity of the hotel to the station. We saved a ton on cab fare! The staff was extremely accomodating and gave us 2 rooms on the same floor even though our travel agents had made a small error with the booking (they booked a "twin" room for my parents but they wanted a larger bed to share). The staff is English speaking and very courteous. The rooms were not impressive at first glance (yes, very small but comfortable) but upon further inspection, they were extremely clean which is what we were most afraid of. The shower was tiny but the bathroom was very sanitary ... the beds were comfy although the pillows were a bit flat. My only real complaint is the bathtowels which were basically more like table cloths than anything else. I would suggest stuffing a fluffy towel into your suitcase and then the hotel is pretty much an amazing deal! There is also CNN International so you can keep up with current events in English. The hotel is located within walking distance of all the major attractions. We did not take a taxi even once in Rome... although being from a big city we might have a higher tolerance for walking than most others. The only attractions you would need a taxi to are those close to Vatican City. (We took a private tour there which picked us up at the hotel, took us to the vatican, then dropped us back off at the hotel for 37 Euro a person) We walked from Hotel Contilia to the Colesseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, Spanish Steps, Trevini Fountain, Piazza Navona, shopping district without any trouble. We did not find the area around the Termini to be threatening at all. We do not speak any Italian and found the people around that area friendly. We were warned of pickpockets and gypsy theives before leaving for Rome but did not encounter any of this, especially not near the Termini. I hope you all choose this hotel for its value. Although it's not a high end luxury hotel, it is great for the traveler who wants to spend more time and money seeing the city than in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEAR TO TERMINI”
Reviews.Author: silky2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for those wanting to use the Italian train system, or the Metro and bus stations, it's a five minutes walk. Not such a great area at night. We booked a superior room which was very comfortable, front desk staff very helpful. Breakfast was ok, the cereal was stale, but plenty of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “V. Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone and thus, made a reservation for a "single" room (110 euro/night). I was surprised to find that my room was literally a "single" room. It contained a single bed and a desk. It was about the size of my college dorm room (and maybe even smaller). I was also not thrilled with the towels (think thin sheets of cloth). After I got over the shock of how small the room was, I was fine. The bathroom was v. clean and the water pressure and temperature were excellent. I also had a v. nice night of sleep (all thanks to my ear plugs). The street where the hotel is located is v. safe and only 2 short blocks to Termini. Because I was so close to Termini, I was able to take the bus and cover more territory. It's a good price if you're traveling alone and if you don't mind a small space.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annakucat
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first visit to Rome and it was more than fantastic, we are just blown away. One of the things that made it was the Hotel Contilia. Just a stones thow from Termini Station and 15 minutes walk from the Colosseum by the shortest route, it has welcoming friendly staff who speak english and didn't smile at my Italian, good serve yourself breakfasts (different rolls, ham cheese, honey, marmalade,fruit juices etc), very comfortable large firm bed, great shower, a safe in the room, air conditioning, so clean you could eat your dinner off the floor - really a very pleasant bolt hole to which we will return. We had read rather negative reports of the area around Termini, we found it lively and colourful, totally non-threatening, with plenty of good & reasonably priced restaurants and little shops on the door step, and the travel connections couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, clean, nicely furnished, staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast was great, exactly what you'd expect/want in a continental hotel, 3 cereals, fresh rolls, ham, cheese, pastries (mainly croissants), choice of juice, chilled water and delicious coffee. The location was also great, we found we could walk everywhere, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wagasa
Reviews.Content: Our family of seven had three rooms for six nights in July 2005. We found the location excellent with many good restaurants in the area and close to the termini for both train and Metro travel. The staff was very helpful and did all they could to make our visit pleasant. Rooms are spotlesly clean, newly painted and immaculate bathrooms. They are small as are most in europe. We loved the firm beds! Our airconditioning worked well and the hot/cold water was never a problem. The hotel is currently being removated and should be complete in September. All work was done during the day and we were never bothered by noise from the construction nor the city/train/etc. Breakfast was adequate as described by other travelers. Michele can answer your emails and he speaks English well enough to be helpful. The only PROBLEM we had was getting to the hotel as the directions were rather vague -translated into English. We all wandered around for 45 min. or so before locating the Contillia. So here's our advice: If you arrive on the train from the airport, DO NOT follow the exit (Ochita) signs down the stairs. Instead follow the Metro signs to the front of the station. You'll know when you get there, by all the shops. Exit the station to your left. You should be on Via Giovanni Gioletti. Walk straight ahead until come to Via Principe Amedeo. Make a left and the hotel will be ahead on your right. Easy and will take less than 5 min. For under 100 Euros/night the price, quality and location of the Contillia can't be beat.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Contilia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amadeo 79d-81, 00185 Rome, Italy
